lines.text: Hello, Griffith Park Zoo, Snake Department. Sssshhh!
Hello? Hello? What is this?
What do you want?
This is Mr Oxley.
I'll see if he's here.
No, I said *this* is Oxley!
Who is?
I am, speaking!
Oh, you're Mr. Speaking...
This is Mr. Oxley speaking!
Oxley Speaking? Any relation to Oxley?
Barnaby Fulton is that you?
Who's calling?
I am, Barnaby!
Oh, no, you're not Barnaby. I'm Barnaby! I ought to know who I am.
This is Oxley speaking, Barnaby!
No, that's ridiculous! You can't be all three. Figure out which one you are and call me back!

[at her secretrial desk, responding to Barnaby's remark that she is at work early]
Mr. Oxley's been complaining about my punctuation, so I'm careful to get here before nine.

[Lois is exposing a beautiful leg to show Barnaby the "new non-rip plastic stockings" he invented. Mr. Oxley enters and is startled]
Miss Laurel was just showing me her acetates.
In my opinion, your opinion that it's a silly song is a silly opinion.
[talking on the telephone to his secretary]
Miss Laurel, now listen carefully! I want you to go to every Ford agency in town! and find Dr. Fulton!
[Miss Laurel looks confused]
But Mr. Oxley, which shall I do first?
All set. Is you motor running?
Is yours?
Takes while to warm up.
Does, me too.
By the way, whose lipstick is it?
Oh, uh, what's her names? Oxley's secretary.
Oh, you mean that little pin up girl? Very cute.
Sort of. But half infant.
Not the half that's visible.
Hi Dr Fulton.
Hi.
What did you say to her?
Mrs Fulton. He said "hi".
I heard what he said, you peroxide kissing bug!
Edwina, she hasn't done anything.
I'll pull that blonde hair out by its black roots!
Edwina! Now come along. Miss Laurel, you keep out of the way.
Put 'em up! Put 'em up! Put 'em up!
I have a new formula.
Now barnaby, if you start that all over again, so help me, I'll...
Oh, I like that dress, yes.
Oh, you do.
Uh-huh.
Alright, what's the new formula?
Well, it doesn't come in packages or bottles. You're old only when you forget you're young.
Come on, say some more.
Hmmm, it's a word you keep in your heart, a light you have in your eyes, someone you hold in your arms.
My, I'm glad I'm going out with you tonight.
[Barnaby and Oxley in his office. Oxley to his secretary Miss Laurel, whose assets are in other areas]
Oh, just a moment Miss Laurel. Find someone to type this.
[Oxley hands Miss Laurel a sheet of paper]
Oh, Mr. Oxley. Can't I try again?
No, it's very important. Better find someone to type it for you.
Yes sir.
[Miss Laurel, disappointed, turns around and saunters out of the office, waggling her behind as she leaves. Both Barnaby and Oxley watch her retreat intently. Then Barnaby turns to look at Oxley]
Anybody can type.
Alright. Now say terrify.
Terrify.
Now say tissue.
tissue.
Now say them both fast together.
Terrify tissue?
[burst in laughs]
Well, I can only tell you, Mrs. Fulton. If you had been smart enough to marry me instead of...
[points at Barnaby]
this, you wouldn't be in the kitchen cooking.
No? Where would she be cooking?

Umph! I'm beginning to wonder if being young is all it's cracked up to be. We dream of youth. We remember it as a time of nightingales and valentines. But what are the facts? Maladjustment, near idiocy, and a series of low comedy disasters. That's what youth is.
Aw, c'mon; let's scalp him!
No; first, we gotta do a war dance!
Mister, will you play with us?
We need a nice tall man to play maypole.
I'm sorry, but I haven't time now.
Don't you like children?
Of course I like children.
Why are you mean to them then?
I'm not mean to them.

[grabbing some pruning sheers]
Ssh, I'm just getting these to scalp a man.

[to a baby after he coos]
No, no familiarities.

[about the baby]
We ought to find out who that is.

[to a baby]
Barnaby, speak to me! I'm your wife!

[on phone]
Hello, Hank.
Edwina!
Can you come over to my house?
What's wrong?
It's Barnaby. He threw a whole bucket of paint all over me! See!

[Miss Laurel opens door]
I told you I didn't want any calls.
Mr. Oxley, Dr. Linten's on the phone. I told him you were busy but he says it's very important.
Who is he?
He...
He's my new assistant.
Oh, yes. Just a moment, Miss Laurel. Find someone to type this.
Oh, Mr. Oxley, can't I try again?
No, it's very important. Better find somebody to type it for you.
Yes, sir.
[Walks to door and closes it]
Anybody can type.
[picks up telephone receiver]
Who did she say was calling?
Dr. Linten.
Oh, yes.
[Speaks to Dr. Linten through receiver]

Yes, Dr. Lintel? Yes? I know he's not there. Dr. Fulton is here with me. Ye - what? Really? What sort of reactions? Why, that's amazing! We'll be right there. Come on, Barnaby. You've done better work than you know.
[Both run to door. Mr. Oxley opens door]
Come along, Miss Laurel. It's amazing.
What's amazing?
Dr. Whatchamacallit says one of your monkeys broke loose. We've got to hurry.
Oh, darling! Stop by the automobile agency. Mr Peabody just called and says he had a very good buy
A good buy? Well, good bye to you!
I remember we didn't wanna share each other with anyone. You were so sweet. Remember how the telephone kept ringing for hours and hours and hours?
[doorbell rings]
I'll get it.
You see what I mean? Tonight were answering calls.
52 this morning I took a dose of the formula,and in a few minutes, I began to behave like a college boy with 20/20 vision and no bursitis.
[acting like 8 years olds after taking some of the formula]
[picks up paint brush and paints Barnaby]
I'll tell my mother!

[picks up his own paint brush and paints Edwina]
Here's one for your mother.

[gets more paint on her brush and paints Barnaby again]
I'll tell Hank Entwhistle!

[gets more paint and paints Edwina again]
Here's two for Hank Entwhistle.
Don't you remember anything?
Well, sure, the last thing... I was scalping Hank Entwhistle.
Now, Edwina, we drove all the way down here to enjoy ourselves and to pursue an important scientific experiment at the same time.
Sodium ascorbate. 3,000 milligrams. You keep quiet Esther.
